intro: Erodium hakkiaricum, commonly known as the Hakkiaric bird's-beak, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. It is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along roadsides. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
